ratings.comment: Prof. Bowie gives great lectures that are easy to pay attention to. She's attentive to students' needs, and the work is graded fairly. There are a lot of readings- an ability to read fast and remember content is important- but the readings are always interesting. The fieldwork projects may be awkward for new students, but it's not difficult.

She loves face so much that she spent 10s minutes explaining her harsh grading (NP ,but she teaches badly) regarding a fired video on Ins cuz she cares us?Doesnt explain materials uninterested for her and 2/3 of lecture is reading PPT,show us documentary.And McDonald is a more senior western restaurant in EAsia (she mixed Korean and Chinese too)??

This professor is extremely hypocritical towards our generation even though she is supposed to be teaching us to be understanding of people with different views of the world. She also assigns an unnecessary number of readings for her students, when she knows most of the students are taking this class to fulfill their ethnic studies requirement.

oof. She never responds to her emails. Test was reading heavy. Do the readings and don't just breeze through the book, make sure you ACTUALLY understand the content bc the exam is 75 multiple choice questions in person at the end of the semester, and if you don't do well you can't go back. It heavily affects your final grade

Bowie is the third section of anthro 100 and the only professor that had her exam in person. The exam covers a whole book, about 10 long and unrelated readings(8-15 pages EACH) in ADDITION to her 150 slide powerpoint lectures for each class (about 10). A TON OF MATERIAL. VERY hard to study for exam. I studied a ton, im sure half the class bombed it

Professor Bowie teaches the last of three sections in Antrho100. There is a ridiculous amount of reading each week in combination with lectures and discussion requirements. Not very well-formatted and lectures bounce around a lot. Very hard to study for the exam because of how example heavy the material is, readings are very important for the test!

I was worried about taking Anthro 330 with this professor based on other comments, but it turned out to be a great experience. I think this professor does better when she isn't teaching Anthro 100. Anthro 330was great even though we read like a book a week. If you're taking an upper level course with her, don't worry, but reconsider if taking 100.

Do not take this class. Bowie was one of three professors teaching it and all three did a horrible job. She expects you to read and understand every small detail from the book with random stories. Lectures are VERY long and wordy. She skips through them very fast and it's hard to understand what you need to know for exams.

Dr. Bowie's section of anthro 100 is by far the easiest, however, her lecture are very confusing and the slides are mostly just pictures and she goes on long tangents about topics that won't be tested on and skips over test subjects. SOOOOOO MUCH READING FOR THIS SECTION. Every week there are new readings and they will be on the test, so do them.
Very boring, very hypocritical, would not take a class with her again. I learned more about her kids than I did anthropology.
Lots of reading but most of it is kind of interesting. Lectures revolve around pretty broad topics and she makes it difficult to know what specific details you need to remember for the exam.

Professor Bowie, as nice as she is, is an unsatisfactory professor. Her section of Anthro 100 (Cultural Anthropology) is the easiest but has the most reading, and her slideshow presentations are ridiculous. They have over 100 slides, and she goes through them very fast. She's nice, her section is easy-ish and interesting but she is unsatisfactory.

Bowie's section of Anth 100 can be quite amusing, but she demands a lot of unnecessary and repetitive readings. It's pretty much impossible to study for the exam because the lecture slides are endless and full of pictures and there are too many readings to fully understand. Her test is moderately difficult.

Bowie's class was arguably the easiest section material wise. However, the lectures has upwards of 120 slides so it was hard to get all the material down along with the speed she sped through them. The exam was pretty difficult, make sure you read both the given books!!

Her lectures were interesting and she is passionate about her studies in Thailand, but she does have a tendency to read off of a slide and immediately switch to the next one before anyone can take notes on it. She posts her PowerPoints online though, so it's not too big of a deal. Her section of Anthro 100 was my favorite and arguably the easiest.

I had Dr. Bowie for the last third of anthropology 100.  She assigns many readings from the textbook.  Her lecture slides are either all pictures or paragraphs of text. She does her research in Thailand and she LOVES to go off on a tangent and talk about it for half the lecture.  I laughed a lot during lecture, but I never learned anything.

You can tell Professor Bowie is quite knowledgable, but her lectures could sometimes be a bit unorganized. Majority of the slides are huge paragraphs that you can't write take notes on or just pictures. She goes on long tangents about Thailand even though it's not what we will even be tested on. Probably the easiest section out of the 3, though.

Professor Bowie was potentially the best lecturer for Anthro 100. She was clearly very knowledgeable. I did not like her tendency to read off the slides. She had a very unpredictable sense of humour, which made the course lectures entertaining. Class was basically story time about her research in Thailand.

She likes to go off on long tangents about readings, and oftentimes half of our 2.5 hour long seminar was pictures, movies, random stories, or other things only partially related to the course content. Never the less, an interesting woman with a lot to say and a lot of knowledge about SE Asia.
I thought I was going to hate Anthro 104, but it ended up being one of my favorite classes because of Bowie. Lots of reading, but she does a pretty good job at finding interesting readings.

Very interesting lecturer, and humorous woman. Tests are fairly easy, but sometimes question on the smallest details from random readings. A lot of boring reading had to be done for this class, but discussions were always interesting.
This class is an easy A or AB IF you read every single word.  Her lectures are boring, she is unorganized and the readings are long and often.  I would avoid this class if you could.

She is one of the worst professors I've had her at Madison.  A lot of reading and all but 2 of the six books were extremely dry. Text book dry people.  Her lectures are all over the place and lack complete structure, and personally I think she is lazy.  Its twice a week, but every week one time is a video and the other someone else lectures.

Easy class overall. Do the weekly readings and you'll be just fine. There are only two exams but like i said, do the readings and you'll be just fine. Bowie is hilarious compared to other professors, too!
Interesting class! Professor Bowie is funny, friendly and engaging. Great  professor!

Super easy class if you do the weekly assigned readings! These also accompany a weekly paper. In addition, the class consists of 2 exams and a Fieldwork project. Lecture is interesting and she shows lots of movies that keep the class entertained.

If you're interested in Buddhism, take this class, especially when offered as a FIG. Katherine is entertaining, witty, & wise. Typically 1 book is assigned per week but it's not necessary to read every page as long as you know enough to be able to write the papers. Don't be afraid to ask for help, Katherine will go out of her way for her students.

Prof Bowie is really random. Her stories are not really related to lecture material. Final was about average. She had some very specific questions, though. Reading the book is essential to getting an A.
She is one of the worst professors I had. Trick question multiple choice exams. Can't win in this one!

I would rate her as good overall, she knows the subject as she has wrote books and has traveled the world. Reading in this class is alot, there were 6 full books to be read and not all of them interesting. Although you can get by without reading them, I would highly recommend trudging through for an easy A, I didnt and the grade showed,

Lectures were pretty incoherent, and exams were nothing more than testing if you read all the books closely and went to all the lectures.  The class would have been awful if I didn't have a good TA.  If you can avoid her, I would recommend it.

Prof Bowie is prob the worst professor I've had in my 4 semesters so far. She is completely unorganized. The class was easy, until she realized like 50% were earning A's and made a ridiculous final that contained info that I had never heard before- and I read every page of every book AND went to every lecture. DO NOT TAKE HER!

Some stuff is interesting, but lectures were beyond boring.  Exams were ridiculous, testing on the most irrelevant stuff.  WAAYY to much reading, which was beyond boring.  I would find a more interesting class to fulfill the ethnic studies requirement, because this was a poorly taught class.

Anthropology is interesting but Bowie takes the fun out of it. She even knows that her students complain about lack of structured examinations but she doesn't do anything about it. We're not asking you to tell us whats on the test we are just asking what we should be thinking about! Everyone basically gets a B in this class. Would not recommend her

I had absolutely no interest in this subject but by the end of the semester I had learned more practical knowledge in Anthro than other classes. Lectures seemed unorganized but it is a tough subject to teach.  Class is easy if you do the reading.  Take this for honors because the best part of class was talking with her during office hours.

I had absolutely no interest in this subject but by the end of the semester I had learned more practical knowledge in Anthro than other classes. Lectures seemed unorganized but it is a tough subject to teach. Class is easy if you do the reading.  Take this for honors because the best part of class was talking with her during office hours.
Katherine Bowie was a disorganized professor.  About 25% of the material on the final was never discussed in class.  Her class did not have a clear direction and was incredibly frustrating.

The class is very broad which makes it difficult to know what is important for the exams.  Bowie is fairly interesting and does have some unique stories. However, she often tries to fit too much into lecture (power points with 120 slides). Lots of reading, required discussions, but if you keep up you should get an A.

Attending lectures is important because there are many details discussed that show up on exams. very specific examples/details. We read 6 books, and knowledge of each book is important, again, with specific details showing up on the exams. Lots of easy points by writing a weekly response paper. Great curve (top 25% gets As and the next 20% ABs)

These are the most pointless and boring lectures; however, the material she covers is really important for the exams.  It is a really easy class if you keep up with the reading.  Read carefully because the exam has some really nit-picky details required to know.

I agree with the last comment. Her lectures are completely irrelevant and beyond frustrating. The course could potentially be extremely interesting (which is even more frustating) but she quickly skips through all the interesting information to tell ridiculously pointless stories.
very nice lady, all homework is basically a completion grade, exams are not bad at all, show up to lecture and you'll do well

I had Katherine for a FIG, and it was a great class.  She is a very friendly prof.  The readings were so so, but discussions were good and the class wasn't hard with writing papers instead of taking tests.  If you are a freshman and Katherine is offering a FIG, take it.
I took the class as part of a FIG and it was great. Katherine is the friendliest prof I've had. As for the class, no tests, just 2 papers. Great discussion, decent readings.

This class is easy and interesting at the same time, but a fair amount of readings is required. Only 2 exams (all MCQs) and one enactment. Much of the exams are based on assigned readings, video clips, guest speakers, and of course lectures. This class will also help you broaden up your perspectives about other cultures around the world.
Pretty much just tells stories during lecture, tests are mostly readings, movies and guest lectures; good class

Professor Bowie is very interesting to listen to, however she talks more about Thailand than she does anything else.  It is very tricky to know what is going to be on the exams.  Read everything...some nit-picky details will smack you in the face on the test.  Other than that, fairly simple.
The class is very simple. Lectures are easy and intresting to listen to.  To do good on the exams read everything.  But an easy class!
easy class, interesting readings, yet in lecture it is hard to decipher what is the important information.  hard to know what to study for on the tests, but they are still pretty simple.

Very little information that is tested on is covered in lecture.  One lecture period a week is devoted to film viewing.  Bowie talks about her field work in Thailand more often than anything that is applicable to her exams.
